intro: Salpingolobivia densispina, commonly known as the dense-spined lungwort, is a striking member of the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, spiny leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, giving it a unique and somewhat rugged appearance. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, adding vibrant color to its habitat. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both horticultural interest and ecological studies.
